meanings.definition: To remove material that is considered improper or offensive from a text.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was bowdlerising the novel before assigning it to the students.
meanings.sent2: The editor was bowdlerising the article to make it suitable for all readers.
meanings.sent3: The librarian joked about bowdlerising the fairy tale to make it less scary for children.
meanings.sent4: She felt like bowdlerising her diary, removing the personal details for privacy.
meanings.sent5: The author spent hours bowdlerising the manuscript to meet the publisher's guidelines.

meanings.definition: To censor or edit a work by removing or altering content deemed inappropriate.
meanings.sent1: The government was bowdlerising the film to comply with regulations.
meanings.sent2: The committee was bowdlerising the speech to avoid controversy.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about bowdlerising his own jokes to keep them family-friendly.
meanings.sent4: Her parents were bowdlerising her social media posts to protect her online image.
meanings.sent5: The artist was bowdlerising the painting to make it suitable for public display.
